alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:13PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of Carbon County through 245 PM EDT... At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong a thunderstorm near Tuscarora, or near Tamaqua, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, New Mahoning, Beltzville State Park, Lake Harmony, Penn Forest Reservoir, Albrightsville, Christmans, Meckesville, Lansford, Summit Hill, Bowmanstown, Beaver Meadows, Parryville, Weissport, Trachsville and Weissport East. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 72 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 287. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
